newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK 28-day Exchange Fund bills undersubscribed.
newsitem.headline: HK 28-day Exchange Fund bills undersubscribed.

text.p: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) said the 28-day Exchange Fund bills tendered on Thursday were undersubscribed.
Bids for the HK$5.0 billion issue totalled only HK$3.25 billion against HK$5.72 billion in the previous tender, it said.
Dealers said the result was not surprising, although it was uncommon for government paper, since many market makers were still on holiday and the accepted yields looked unattractive.
The average accepted yield of the shortest bills at today's tender was 4.40 percent against the average accepted yield of 4.34 percent in the previous tender on Tuesday.

"Dealers would rather buy bonds in the secondary market than making a bid as some participants believed that it's bad luck to take such low yield paper at the beginning of the year," one bond dealer said.
One-month HIBOR settled at 0330 gmt was 5.36979 percent.
The issue was the roll-over of the third batch of special one-month Exchange Fund bills issued to facilitate the implementation of the real-time settlement system in early December.
But the tender size had been trimmed down from HK$10 billion. -- Hong Kong Newsroom (852) 2843 6369
